privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: HSFP.tokyo is committed to protecting your privacy. This policy explains how we handle your data when you use our HSFP visa points calculator.

no_collection.title: No Personal Data Collection
no_collection.content: We do not collect, store, or transmit any personal information to our servers. Your calculator responses and results are never sent to us. All calculations happen entirely in your browser.

local_storage.title: Browser Local Storage
local_storage.content: We use your browser's local storage to save your preferences locally on your device. This data never leaves your browser and includes:

items.calculator: Calculator state and evidence checklist progress

control.title: Your Control
control.content: You can clear all locally stored data at any time through the Settings page on this site, or by clearing your browser's site data. Since all data is stored locally, deleting it is immediate and permanent.

third_party.title: Third-Party Services
third_party.content: All assets (fonts, images, scripts) are self-hosted on our servers. We do not use any third-party analytics, tracking, or advertising services. No data is shared with third parties.

changes.title: Changes to This Policy
changes.content: We may update this privacy policy in the future, for example if we add analytics to improve the site. Any changes will be reflected on this page with an updated date. We encourage you to review this page periodically.

contact.title: Contact
contact.content: If you have questions about this privacy policy, please contact us at

author.name: Anton Van Eechaute
author.bio: Originally from Belgium, I've been living in Tokyo since 2016. I came to Japan on a working visa and later obtained permanent residency through the HSFP visa program.

motivation.title: Why I Built This
motivation.content: When I was preparing my own HSFP application, I found the official points calculation sheet confusing and tedious to work with. The PDF forms weren't interactive, and it was hard to understand which categories applied to my situation. I built this calculator to make the process easier for others going through the same journey.

partnership.title: For Immigration Professionals
partnership.content: Are you a 行政書士 (administrative scrivener) or immigration professional? I'm open to advertising on this site to help visitors find qualified help with their applications.
partnership.cta: If you're interested, reach out at

source.title: Sources & Disclaimer
source.isa_link: This calculator is based on the official points calculation criteria published by the Immigration Services Agency (ISA) of Japan.
source.disclaimer: While I strive to keep this calculator accurate and up-to-date, immigration rules can change. This tool is for informational purposes only and should not be considered legal advice.
source.contact: If you notice any errors or outdated information, please let me know at

pr_fast_track.title: Fast-Track to Permanent Residency
pr_fast_track.description: Apply for PR in just 1 year with 80+ points, or 3 years with 70+ points. Standard visas require 10 years of residence.

five_year_visa.title: 5-Year Visa Duration

family.title: Family Benefits

priority_processing.title: Priority Processing

multiple_activities.title: Multiple Activities

indefinite_stay.title: Path to Indefinite Stay
indefinite_stay.description: After 3 years on HSFP (i), you can apply for HSFP (ii) status with indefinite stay period.

how_to_improve.title: How to increase your points
how_to_improve.intro: The HSFP visa requires a minimum of 70 points. Here are some ways you can potentially earn more points:

experience.title: Professional Experience (up to 20 points)
experience.description: Work experience in your field counts: 10+ years awards 20 points, 7+ years 15 points, 5+ years 10 points, and 3+ years 5 points. Only experience relevant to your visa category is counted.

salary.title: Annual Salary (up to 40 points)
salary.description: Your expected annual salary in Japan significantly impacts your score. ¥10M+ earns 40 points, ¥9M+ earns 35 points, ¥8M+ earns 30 points. Lower salary brackets (¥4M-7M) also award points but have age restrictions. Consider negotiating your salary or exploring higher-paying opportunities.

japanese.title: Japanese Language (up to 15 points)
japanese.description: JLPT N1 or equivalent awards 15 points, N2 awards 10 points. Studying Japanese and obtaining certification is one of the most actionable ways to gain additional points.

certifications.title: Professional Certifications (up to 10 points)
certifications.description: Holding Japanese national certifications (国家資格) or IT certifications from the official IT certification list awards 5 points for one certification or 10 points for two or more. Examples include IT Passport, Information Security Management, and various engineering certifications.

overview.title: Results overview
overview.disclaimer: Note: The points shown for each item reflect their individual values, but your total may differ from a simple sum. Some categories have caps (e.g., university bonuses are limited to 10 points regardless of how many you qualify for), and certain combinations may not stack. The total shown accounts for these rules.

permanent_residency.title: Fast track to Permanent Residency
permanent_residency.intro: Those who qualify for the HSFP visa are also eligible to fast-track their Permanent Residency application. You must meet one of the following conditions:
permanent_residency.condition1: Be able to prove 80+ points at the time of application and 1 year ago
permanent_residency.condition2: Be able to prove 70+ points at the time of application and 3 years ago
permanent_residency.visa_note: You don't necessarily need to be on the HSFP visa already to take advantage of this fast-track to Permanent Residency. Just being able to prove you have the points in the past and currently is enough.
permanent_residency.length_warning: However, just like any other Permanent Residency route you must already be on a valid visa with a length of stay of three years or longer.
permanent_residency.political_caveat: Note: Permanent residency is currently a hot topic in Japanese politics and policies may change. This information was current as of January 2026.

evidence.title: Required evidence
evidence.description1: When applying for this visa you need to submit evidence proving your qualifications. The documents listed below are for reference - depending on your situation, you may need all listed documents or only some.
evidence.description2: If you have significantly more than 80 points (e.g., 100+), you only need to provide evidence to prove 80 points total - you don't need to provide evidence for every single point category. This can significantly reduce the amount of documentation you need to prepare.
evidence.description3: For the most accurate guidance, consider consulting a licensed administrative scrivener (行政書士) to prepare your application.
evidence.empty: No specific evidence requirements based on your selections.

doctor.documents: Graduation certificate or diploma | Degree certificate (showing doctorate was conferred) | Academic transcript (if degree type is unclear from certificate)
doctor.notes: Documents must clearly show the type of degree obtained. If original documents are not in Japanese or English, a certified translation is required.

mba_mot.documents: Graduation certificate or diploma | Degree certificate (showing MBA or MOT was conferred) | Academic transcript (if degree type is unclear from certificate)
mba_mot.notes: Only MBA (Master of Business Administration) or MOT (Master of Technology Management) degrees qualify. Must have graduated from university before obtaining MBA/MOT for bonus points.

master.documents: Graduation certificate or diploma | Degree certificate (showing master degree was conferred)

bachelor.documents: Graduation certificate or diploma | Degree certificate (showing bachelor degree was conferred)

dual_degree.documents: Graduation certificates for each degree | Academic transcripts showing different major fields | Degree certificates for each qualification
dual_degree.notes: Degrees must be in different academic fields (e.g., Engineering + Business). Both a master and doctorate count as 30 points total.

10y_plus.documents: Documents proving work content and duration (e.g., employment certificate, contract, appointment letter)
10y_plus.notes: Experience must be related to the activities you will engage in under the HSFP visa. Documents should show job title, duties, and employment period.

7y_plus.documents: Documents proving work content and duration (e.g., employment certificate, contract, appointment letter)
7y_plus.notes: Experience must be related to the activities you will engage in under the HSFP visa. Documents should show job title, duties, and employment period.

5y_plus.documents: Documents proving work content and duration (e.g., employment certificate, contract, appointment letter)
5y_plus.notes: Experience must be related to the activities you will engage in under the HSFP visa. Documents should show job title, duties, and employment period.

3y_plus.documents: Documents proving work content and duration (e.g., employment certificate, contract, appointment letter)
3y_plus.notes: Experience must be related to the activities you will engage in under the HSFP visa. Documents should show job title, duties, and employment period.

10m_plus.documents: Employment contract showing annual compensation | Offer letter with salary details | For renewals: withholding tax statement (源泉徴収票) or tax certificate
10m_plus.notes: Salary must be the expected annual compensation from your contracting organization in Japan. Bonuses and allowances are included, but commuting and housing allowances are typically excluded.

9m_plus.documents: Employment contract showing annual compensation | Offer letter with salary details | For renewals: withholding tax statement (源泉徴収票) or tax certificate
9m_plus.notes: Salary must be the expected annual compensation from your contracting organization in Japan. Bonuses and allowances are included, but commuting and housing allowances are typically excluded.

8m_plus.documents: Employment contract showing annual compensation | Offer letter with salary details | For renewals: withholding tax statement (源泉徴収票) or tax certificate
8m_plus.notes: Salary must be the expected annual compensation from your contracting organization in Japan. Bonuses and allowances are included, but commuting and housing allowances are typically excluded.

7m_plus.documents: Employment contract showing annual compensation | Offer letter with salary details | For renewals: withholding tax statement (源泉徴収票) or tax certificate
7m_plus.notes: Only applicable if under 40 years old at time of application. Salary must be the expected annual compensation from your contracting organization in Japan.

6m_plus.documents: Employment contract showing annual compensation | Offer letter with salary details | For renewals: withholding tax statement (源泉徴収票) or tax certificate
6m_plus.notes: Only applicable if under 40 years old at time of application. Salary must be the expected annual compensation from your contracting organization in Japan.

5m_plus.documents: Employment contract showing annual compensation | Offer letter with salary details | For renewals: withholding tax statement (源泉徴収票) or tax certificate
5m_plus.notes: Only applicable if under 35 years old at time of application. Salary must be the expected annual compensation from your contracting organization in Japan.

4m_plus.documents: Employment contract showing annual compensation | Offer letter with salary details | For renewals: withholding tax statement (源泉徴収票) or tax certificate
4m_plus.notes: Only applicable if under 30 years old at time of application. Salary must be the expected annual compensation from your contracting organization in Japan.

under_30y.notes: Age is verified from your passport at time of application.

under_35y.notes: Age is verified from your passport at time of application.

under_40y.notes: Age is verified from your passport at time of application.

patent_inventor.documents: Copy of patent certificate with applicant's name clearly shown as inventor
patent_inventor.notes: You must be listed as an inventor on the patent(s) you are claiming.

conducted_financed_projects.documents: Grant award notification or funding decision documents with applicant's name
conducted_financed_projects.notes: Must have received competitive research funding from a foreign government at least 3 times.

published_papers.documents: List of publications with: title, author names, journal name, issue number, volume, pages, publication year
published_papers.notes: Papers must be in journals indexed in academic databases such as Web of Science (Clarivate/Thomson Reuters) or Scopus (Elsevier). You must be the responsible/corresponding author.

recognized_research.notes: This is a catch-all category for research achievements not covered by other criteria. Consult with immigration for guidance on what qualifies and required documentation.

many_certs.documents: Certificate copies for each qualification | Proof of passing examination (合格証明書)
many_certs.notes: Qualifications must be Japanese national certifications (国家資格) or IT certifications listed in the IT certification announcement (IT告示). Business-exclusive qualifications (業務独占資格) or name-exclusive qualifications (名称独占資格) qualify.

single_cert.documents: Certificate copies for each qualification | Proof of passing examination (合格証明書)
single_cert.notes: Must be a Japanese national certification (国家資格) or IT certification listed in the IT certification announcement (IT告示).

org_promotes_innovation.documents: Copy of subsidy/grant award decision notification (補助金交付決定通知書の写し) | Company documentation proving innovation support status
org_promotes_innovation.notes: Organization must be receiving financial support measures for promotion of innovation.

org_smb.documents: Company brochure or website showing company size | Corporate registration certificate (法人の登記事項証明書) | Documents showing capital amount and number of employees | Financial statements showing revenue and employee count
org_smb.notes: Must meet SME criteria under the Small and Medium-Sized Enterprise Basic Act: Manufacturing: capital ≤¥300M or employees ≤300; Wholesale: capital ≤¥100M or employees ≤100; Retail: capital ≤¥50M or employees ≤50; Service: capital ≤¥50M or employees ≤100.

org_promotes_highly_skilled.documents: Copy of subsidy/grant award decision notification (補助金交付決定通知書の写し) | Documentation from local government showing support for highly skilled worker acceptance
org_promotes_highly_skilled.notes: Organization receives support from local public entities for promoting acceptance of highly skilled foreign workers.

high_rnd_expenses.documents: Financial statements (決算書) showing R&D expenses and total revenue | Or: certification letter from a certified tax accountant (税理士), CPA (公認会計士), or SME consultant (中小企業診断士)
high_rnd_expenses.notes: R&D expenses must exceed 3% of total revenue (gross revenue minus income from securities transactions). Must be an SME. The professional certification is a letter issued by the accountant/consultant certifying the R&D ratio.

jp_major.documents: Graduation certificate showing Japanese language major | Academic transcript showing Japanese language as major field of study
jp_major.notes: Must have majored in Japanese language at a foreign university or graduated from a foreign university where instruction was primarily in Japanese.

n1.documents: JLPT N1 certificate (日本語能力試験N1合格証明書) | Or equivalent certification (BJT Business Japanese Test J1+, etc.)
n1.notes: Cannot claim both N1/N2 and Japanese university graduation points together (except for those listed in ① above).

n2.documents: JLPT N2 certificate (日本語能力試験N2合格証明書) | Or equivalent certification
n2.notes: Cannot be claimed if you graduated from a Japanese university or completed a graduate program in Japan. Cannot claim both N1/N2 and Japanese university graduation points (except for those listed in ① above).

jp_uni_grad.documents: Graduation certificate from Japanese university | Degree certificate from Japanese institution
jp_uni_grad.notes: Includes completion of graduate programs (master or doctorate) at Japanese universities.

uni_ranked.notes: Foreign universities must appear in top 300 of at least 2 of the 3 rankings (QS, THE, ARWU). Japanese universities only need to appear in 1 ranking. Can be claimed together with "Graduated from Japanese university" bonus.

uni_funded.notes: University must receive subsidies under the Top Global Universities Project (スーパーグローバル大学創成支援事業) implemented by MEXT. Can be claimed together with "Graduated from Japanese university" bonus.

uni_partner.notes: University must be designated as a "Partner School" in the Innovative Asia Project (イノベーティブ・アジア事業) implemented by Ministry of Foreign Affairs. Can be claimed together with "Graduated from Japanese university" bonus.

foreign_qualification.documents: Certificate or license document for the qualification
foreign_qualification.notes: Must be a qualification from the designated list published by the Ministry of Justice. For awards related to enterprise products/services, you must have been professionally involved in creating/developing them (not just as a purchaser).

growth_field.documents: Documentation from employer about the project | Notification or certification from relevant ministry showing project is in designated growth field
growth_field.notes: Project must be in a growth field with involvement of relevant government ministries and agencies.

training_jica.documents: JICA training completion certificate (JICA研修修了証明書)
training_jica.notes: Training must be conducted by JICA as part of the Innovative Asia Project, with a training period of at least 1 year. If submitting JICA completion certificate, academic and employment documents are generally not required unless claiming work experience points.

investment_management.documents: Employment contract describing investment management duties | Documentation of investment fund management activities | Evidence of managing assets exceeding ¥100M in trades/investments for third parties
investment_management.notes: Applies to those engaged in investment fund management or discretionary investment business. Must be managing substantial third-party investments.

representative_director.documents: Corporate registration certificate (法人の登記事項証明書) showing appointment as representative director | Board resolution appointing as representative | Employment contract or appointment letter
representative_director.notes: Must be appointed as representative director (代表取締役), representative executive officer (代表執行役), or representative executive member (代表権のある業務執行社員). Cannot be combined with executive officer bonus.

executive_officer.documents: Corporate registration certificate (法人の登記事項証明書) showing appointment | Board resolution appointing as director/officer | Employment contract or appointment letter
executive_officer.notes: Must be appointed as board director (取締役), executive officer (執行役), or executive member (業務執行社員). Cannot be combined with representative director bonus.

high_investment.documents: Investment documentation showing ¥100M+ investment | Bank statements or wire transfer records | Corporate documentation showing ownership stake | Investment agreements or contracts
high_investment.notes: Investment must be in trade or other business conducted by a public or private organization in Japan. The ¥100M investment must be made by the applicant.

30m_plus.documents: Employment contract showing annual compensation | Offer letter with salary details | For renewals: withholding tax statement (源泉徴収票) or tax certificate
30m_plus.notes: Salary must be the expected annual compensation from your contracting organization in Japan. Bonuses and allowances are included, but commuting and housing allowances are typically excluded.

25m_plus.notes: Salary must be the expected annual compensation from your contracting organization in Japan. Bonuses and allowances are included, but commuting and housing allowances are typically excluded.

15m_plus.notes: Salary must be the expected annual compensation from your contracting organization in Japan. Bonuses and allowances are included, but commuting and housing allowances are typically excluded.

options.none: I have no higher education degree

dual_degree.title: Multiple degrees
dual_degree.prompt: Do you hold multiple master's or doctorate degrees in different fields?

faq.q0: Do multiple majors count as different degrees?
faq.a0: No. The regulation requires separate degrees (学位) in different fields (複数の分野), not just multiple majors within a single degree program. A double major or dual major within a single bachelor's or master's degree program does not qualify for the 5 bonus points.
faq.q1: What if I have multiple bachelor's degrees or a bachelor's + master's?
faq.a1: The 5 bonus points are only awarded for having multiple degrees at the master's, doctorate, or professional degree level. For example: two master's degrees in different fields = 25 points (20 + 5 bonus), but a bachelor's + master's in different fields = only 20 points (no bonus). Multiple bachelor's degrees also do not qualify for the bonus.

experience.title: Professional experience
experience.prompt: How many years of relevant professional experience do you have?

faq.q0: What counts as "practical experience" (実務経験)?
faq.a0: For engineers: Experience in research, research guidance, or education in your field. The experience must be directly related to your intended technical/specialized activities in Japan.
faq.q1: Does my experience outside my home country count?
faq.a1: Yes, all qualifying work experience counts regardless of the country where it was obtained, as long as it's relevant to engineering/technical work.

age.title: Age
age.prompt: How old are you at the time of application?

faq.q0: Why does age matter for points?
faq.a0: Younger applicants receive bonus points (15 points for under 30, 10 points for 30-34, 5 points for 35-39) to encourage long-term contribution to Japan's economy and innovation.
faq.q1: Which age is used for calculation?
faq.a1: Your age at the time of application (or visa status determination) is used for the points calculation.

salary.title: Salary
salary.prompt: What is the expected yearly total compensation at your main activity?

faq.q0: What income sources are included?
faq.a0: Your total annual income includes compensation from both your contracting organization in Japan AND any foreign affiliated organization (if you're being transferred from an overseas branch).
faq.q1: Do I need to provide my exact salary?
faq.a1: Round down to the nearest million yen (e.g., ¥8.7M becomes ¥8M). Points max out at ¥10 million, so there's no benefit to entering higher amounts. Your salary information is not stored on our servers—all data stays in your browser.
faq.a2: Your points are calculated based on your expected annual salary at the time of application. If your salary increases later, you may be able to recalculate points for visa renewal.

patent_inventor.title: Patents
patent_inventor.prompt: Have you successfully patented any of your inventions?

conducted_financed_projects.title: Financing
conducted_financed_projects.prompt: Have you engaged in foreign government funded research at least 3 times?

faq.q0: What counts as "research funded by foreign governments"?
faq.a0: Participation in research projects that received grants, competitive funding, or other financial support from foreign government agencies. You need 3 or more such experiences.

published_papers.title: Published work
published_papers.prompt: Have you published at least 3 papers in academic journals listed in academic databases as the corresponding author?

faq.q0: What qualifies as a "responsible author" (責任著者) for publications?
faq.a0: A responsible author is the corresponding author who can respond to inquiries about the paper. You need at least 3 such publications in academic journals registered in databases used by Japanese government agencies.

recognized_research.title: Other achievements
recognized_research.prompt: Do you have any other research achievements which are recognized by Japan's Minister of Justice?

faq.q0: What other research achievements might qualify?
faq.a0: This includes research achievements not covered by patents, government-funded projects, or publications, but deemed equivalent by the Minister of Justice after consulting with relevant administrative agencies.

org_promotes_innovation.title: Innovation
org_promotes_innovation.prompt: Will you work for an organization which receives financial support measures for the promotion of innovation?

faq.q0: What qualifies as 'innovation support measures'?
faq.a0:
This refers to organizations receiving government subsidies or grants for innovation-related projects. Examples include:
  • Companies with an approved Management Innovation Plan (経営革新計画) from their prefectural government
  • Organizations receiving Grants-in-Aid for Scientific Research
  • J-Startup designated companies
You don't need to be personally involved in the innovation project—just employed by a qualifying organization. Ask your employer's HR department if they have received any qualifying subsidies. The official list is maintained by the Immigration Services Agency.

org_smb.title: SME act
org_smb.prompt: Is your organization recognized as a small or medium-sized enterprise under the Small and Medium-Sized Enterprise Basic Act?

org_promotes_highly_skilled.title: Highly skilled
org_promotes_highly_skilled.prompt: Does your organization receive support from local governments for promoting the acceptance of highly skilled foreign workers?

faq.q0: What support programs qualify?
faq.a0: Organizations receiving government support or subsidies specifically for accepting highly skilled foreign professionals may qualify for bonus points.

high_rnd_expenses.title: R&D expenses
high_rnd_expenses.prompt: Is your organization an SME with research & development costs exceeding 3% of total revenue?

faq.q0: What is the "R&D expense ratio" bonus?
faq.a0: SME employers can qualify for 5 bonus points if their research and development expenses exceed 3% of their revenue in the fiscal year before your application.
faq.q1: How is the R&D ratio calculated?
faq.a1: It's calculated by dividing the total of research/development expenses and costs for starting new businesses by the total revenue (excluding income from fixed asset sales or securities transfers) in the previous fiscal year.

growth_field.title: Growth field
growth_field.prompt: Will you be involved in a project in a growth field with the involvement of the relevant ministries and agencies?

faq.q0: What are "growth fields with expected future development"?
faq.a0: These are cutting-edge business sectors recognized by the Minister of Justice after consulting with relevant government agencies. This typically includes emerging technologies and strategic industries. See the official list of growth fields (PDF).

certification.title: Certificates
certification.prompt: How many relevant national or IT certifications do you hold?

faq.q0: What qualifications count for points?
faq.a0: IT-related qualifications and exams designated by the Minister of Justice. You can earn 10 points for having 2+ certifications, or 5 points for 1 certification.

faq.q0: Do multiple majors count as different degrees?

faq.q1: What if I have multiple bachelor's degrees or a bachelor's + master's?

age.title: Age
age.prompt: How old are you at the time of application?

faq.q0: Why does age matter for points?
faq.a0: Younger applicants receive bonus points (15 points for under 30, 10 points for 30-34, 5 points for 35-39) to encourage long-term contribution to Japan's academic and research sectors.
faq.q1: Which age is used for calculation?
faq.a1: Your age at the time of application (or visa status determination) is used for the points calculation.

salary.title: Salary
salary.prompt: What is the expected yearly total compensation at your main activity?

faq.q0: What income sources are included?
faq.a0: Your total annual income includes compensation from both your contracting organization in Japan AND any foreign affiliated organization (if you're being transferred from an overseas institution).
faq.q1: Do I need to provide my exact salary?
faq.a1: Round down to the nearest million yen (e.g., ¥8.7M becomes ¥8M). Points max out at ¥10 million, so there's no benefit to entering higher amounts. Your salary information is not stored on our servers—all data stays in your browser.
faq.a2: Your points are calculated based on your expected annual salary at the time of application. If your salary increases later, you may be able to recalculate points for visa renewal.

faq.q0: What qualifies as a "responsible author" (責任著者) for publications?
faq.a0: A responsible author is the corresponding author who can respond to inquiries about the paper. You need at least 3 such publications in academic journals registered in databases used by Japanese government agencies.
